alert.note: Alert for Erie (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 3:29PM EDT until August 25 at 10:40AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Vermilion River Near Vermilion affecting Lorain and Erie Counties. For the Huron River...including Milan...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Vermilion River...including Vermilion...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Huron River Near Milan. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Flood waters over a foot deep in Franklin Flats. Huron River Valley Campground inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EDT Thursday was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.8 feet on 03/11/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM EDT.
